item.title: You Can Now Pay For Your Games from Steam With Bitcoin
item.description:
You Can Now Pay For Your Games from Steam With Bitcoin

Valve has officially added support for Bitcoin payments in their Steam platform for distributing games online, meaning that millions of gamers worldwide can now pay with BTC for their new game purchases. There has been some rumors and leaks suggesting that this will happen at some point, but it is official now and you can already pay with Bitcoin at Steam.

item.title: Andreas Antonopoulos Makes Bold Prediction on Bitcoin Consensus
item.description:
Andreas Antonopoulos Makes Bold Prediction on Bitcoin Consensus

Andreas Antonopoulos surprised a crowd at a Berlin Bitcoin conference last week by claiming that, by the end of this year, Bitcoin's consensus algorithm will be totally changed. Also read: BitcoinAverage Report: Bitcoin Price Hits 2016 High The prediction comes after a much-publicized block size debate in which developers have disagreed on how to update the Bitcoin system in order for it to keep pace with growth in transaction demand.

item.title: Accidentally Spent $136,000 in Bitcoin? This Mining Pool is Looking for You - CoinDesk
item.description:
Accidentally Spent $136,000 in Bitcoin? This Mining Pool is Looking for You - CoinDesk

A bitcoin transaction with a 291 BTC fee worth $136,700 was processed as part of block 409,008 on the bitcoin network today, sparking speculation as to the nature of what many are considering a colossal error by an unknown user.

item.title: Pay or we'll knock your site offline-DDoS-for-ransom attacks surge
item.description:
Pay or we'll knock your site offline-DDoS-for-ransom attacks surge

A number of sites have been hit by distributed denial-of-service attacks over the past week. Strong enough to knock some of them offline for days at a time, these DDoS attacks have been launched by extortionists demanding thousands of dollars in ransom money. Follow-on attacks show capabilities "commonly possessed by state-sponsored actors."

item.title: The Price of Bitcoin is Now Double What it Was One Year Ago - CoinDesk
item.description:
The Price of Bitcoin is Now Double What it Was One Year Ago - CoinDesk

Bitcoin prices have more than doubled over the last year, enjoying a period of reasonable growth as the digital currency continues to establish its legitimacy. Global bitcoin prices reached an inter-day high of $470.16 on 26th April, more than 100% above the inter-day high of $219.93 reached on the same day in 2015.
